content: <CoRIS>  <Local-number>Center2008g </Local-number>  <Author>Miller, J. E. </Author>  <Title>PIFSC Cruise Report CR-08-008 (Cruise 08-04) </Title>  <Institution>NOAA PIFSC </Institution>  <Publication-Place>Honolulu, HI </Publication-Place>  <Publication-Date><caldate>2008 </caldate></Publication-Date>  <Extent>30 </Extent>  <Type-Period-Note>Vessel: Hi'ialakai, Cruise 08-04; Cruise Period: 2 - 29 May 2008; Area of Operation: Necker Island, French Frigate Shoals (FFS), Brooks Banks, Northwestern Hawaiian Islands, Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument (PMNM) </Type-Period-Note>  <Notes>CRCP Project ID 1221; Project Title: Pacific Reef Assessment and Monitoring Program (Pacific RAMP): Biennial Monitoring for the U.S. Pacific Islands and Atolls; Principal Investigator: Rusty Brainard </Notes>  <Abstract>This report details the multibeam mapping, camera operation, and diving deployment activities conducted to characterize the benthic habitats of Necker Islands, French Frigate Shoals (FFS), Brooks Banks, Northwestern Hawaiian Islands, and the Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument in May 2008 as part of the Hi`ialakai Cruise 08-04. </Abstract>  <Date-Time-Last-Modified>20091112000000 </Date-Time-Last-Modified>  <URL>http://www.pifsc.noaa.gov/library/pubs/cruise/Hiialakai/CRHI0804-JM.pdf </URL>  <project>  <ID>1221 </ID>  <title>Pacific Reef Assessment and Monitoring Program (Pacific RAMP): Biennial Monitoring for the U.S. Pacific Islands and Atolls </title>  <PI>Rusty Brainard </PI>  </project>  <Region>NWHI </Region>  <Bounding>  <Eastbc>-160.5 </Eastbc>  <Westbc>-180 </Westbc>  <Southbc>22.5 </Southbc>  <Northbc>35.0 </Northbc>  </Bounding>  <CoRIS-Record-Type>techreport </CoRIS-Record-Type>  <Local-subject-index>techreport </Local-subject-index>  <Local-subject-index>publication </Local-subject-index>  <resdesc>CoRIS Bibliographic </resdesc> </CoRIS>
